Authors:
Santiago Chacón, Dorian Dennis Dörge, Jascha Levin Fedor
Weisenborn, Meike Piepenbring
Title:
A new species and a new record of Diatrypaceae (Xylariales)
from Panama
Keywords:
Alnus, Ascomycota, ChiriquÃ­ province, Diatrype
bermudensis, Eutypella semicircularis, Guadua
Abstract:
Based on opportunistic collections of fungi in Panama, two
species of Diatrypaceae are described and illustrated. One of them,
Eutypella semicircularis found twice on branches probably belonging to
Alnus acuminata is new to science. It differs from known species of
Eutypella with strongly allantoid or semicircular ascospores, like E.
crustata and E. curvispora (now Peroneutya curvispora), by larger
ascospores sometimes almost forming a circle and broader stromata, among
other differences. Molecular data of ITS rDNA region show that the new
species is a sister taxon of Eutypella cerviculata, the type species of
the genus Eutypella. Diatrype bermudensis on stems of Guadua
angustifolia is reported for Panama for the first time, being reported
up to now apparently only from Bermuda.
